metadata.titleCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验：水文气象观测网数据集（阿柔超级站气象要素梯度观测系统-2013）
metadata.description:
This dataset includes data recorded by the Hydrometeorological observation network obtained from an observation system of Meteorological elements gradient of A’rou Superstation between 14 October, 2012, and 31 December, 2013. The site (100.464° E, 38.047° N) was located on a cold grassland surface in the Caodaban village, A’rou Town, Qilian County, Qinghai Province. The elevation is 3033 m. The installation heights and orientations of different sensors and measured quantities were as follows: air temperature and humidity profile (HMP45C; 1, 2, 5, 10, 15 and 25 m, towards north), wind speed profile (010C; 1, 2, 5, 10, 15 and 25 m, towards north), wind direction profile (020C; 2 m, towards north), air pressure (CS100; 2 m), rain gauge (TE525M; 5 m, towards south), four-component radiometer (CNR4; 5 m, towards south), two infrared temperature sensors (SI-111; 5 m, towards south, vertically downward), photosynthetically active radiation (PAR-LITE; 5 m, towards south, vertically upward), soil heat flux (HFP01SC; 3 duplicates, -0.06 m, 2 m in the south of tower), a TCAV averaging soil thermocouple probe (TCAV; -0.02, -0.04 m, 2 m in the south of tower), soil temperature profile (109; 0, -0.02, -0.04, -0.06, -0.1, -0.15, -0.2, -0.3, -0.4, -0.6, -0.8, -1.2, -1.6, -2, -2.4, -2.8 and -3.2 m, 3 duplicates in -0.04 m and -0.1 m), and soil moisture profile (CS616; -0.02, -0.04, -0.06, -0.1, -0.15, -0.2, -0.3, -0.4, -0.6, -0.8, -1.2, -1.6, -2, -2.4, -2.8 and -3.2 m, 3 duplicates in -0.04 m and -0.1 m).
The observations included the following: air temperature and humidity (Ta_1 m, Ta_2 m, Ta_5 m, Ta_10 m, Ta_15 m and Ta_25 m; RH_1 m, RH_2 m, RH_5 m, RH_10 m, RH_15 m and RH_25 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_1 m, Ws_2 m, Ws_5 m, Ws_10 m, Ws_15 m and Ws_25 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_2 m) (°), air pressure (press) (hpa), precipitation (rain) (mm), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m2), infrared temperature (IRT_1 and IRT_2) (℃), photosynthetically active radiation (PAR) (μmol/(s m-2)), average soil temperature (TCAV, ℃), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2 and Gs_3) (W/m2), soil temperature (Ts_0 cm, Ts_2 cm, Ts_4 cm_1, Ts_4 cm_2, Ts_4 cm_3, Ts_6 cm, Ts_10 cm_1, Ts_10 cm_2, Ts_10 cm_3, Ts_15 cm, Ts_20 cm, Ts_30 cm, Ts_40 cm, Ts_60 cm, Ts_80 cm, Ts_120 cm, Ts_160 cm, Ts_200 cm, Ts_240 cm, Ts_280 cm and Ts_320 cm) (℃), and soil moisture (Ms_2 cm, Ms_4 cm_1, Ms_4 cm_2, Ms_4 cm_3, Ms_6 cm, Ms_10 cm_1, Ms_10 cm_2, Ms_10 cm_3, Ms_15 cm, Ms_20 cm, Ms_30 cm, Ms_40 cm, Ms_60 cm, Ms_80 cm, Ms_120 cm, Ms_160 cm, Ms_200 cm, Ms_240 cm, Ms_280 cm and Ms_320 cm) (%, volumetric water content).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 10 min for a total of 144 records per day (The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 30 min before 4 December, 2012 for a total of 48 records per day). The average soil temperature, soil heat flux, soil temperature and soil moisture were missing during 30 November, 2012 and 8 December, 2012, 21 April, 2013 and 31 May, 2013 because of insufficient power supply; Wind speed in 2 m and 5 m were missing during 28 December, 2012 and 28 March, 2012 because of datalogger repairing. The missing data were denoted by -6999. (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2013-6-10 10:30. (6)  the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Liu et al.(2018), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al.(2011).
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2012年10月14日至2013年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网上游阿柔超级站气象要素梯度观测系统数据。站点位于青海省祁连县阿柔乡草达坂村，下垫面是高寒草地。观测点的经纬度是100.4643E,38.0473N，海拔3033m。空气温度、相对湿度、风速传感器分别架设在1m、2m、5m、10m、15m、25m处，共6层，朝向正北；风向传感器架设在2m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在2m处；翻斗式雨量计在2013年2月28日前安装在超级站附近10m铁塔上，之后安装在阿柔超级站40m观测塔上；四分量辐射仪安装在5m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在5m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；光合有效辐射仪安装在5m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向上；土壤部分传感器埋设在塔体正南方向2m处，其中土壤热流板（自校正式）（3块）均埋设在地下6cm处；平均土壤温度传感器TCAV埋设在地下2cm、4cm处；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、6cm、10cm、15cm、20cm、30cm、40cm、60cm、80cm、120cm、160cm、200cm、240cm、280cm、320cm处，其中4cm和10cm这两层有三个重复；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm、6cm、10cm、15cm、20cm、30cm、40cm、60cm、80cm、120cm、160cm、200cm、240cm、280cm、320cm处，其中4cm和10cm这两层有三个重复。
观测项目有：风速（WS_1m、WS_2m、WS_5m、WS_10m、WS_15m、WS_25m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、空气温湿度（Ta_1m、Ta_2m、Ta_5m、Ta_10m、Ta_15m、Ta_25m和RH_1m、RH_2m、RH_5m、RH_10m、RH_15m、RH_25m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、光合有效辐射（PAR）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)、平均土壤温度（TCAV）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm_1、Ms_4cm_2、Ms_4cm_3、Ms_6cm、Ms_10cm_1、Ms_10cm_2、Ms_10cm_3、Ms_15cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_30cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_60cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm Ms_200cm、Ms_240cm、Ms_280cm、Ms_320cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm_1、Ts_4cm_2、Ts_4cm_3、Ts_6cm、Ts_10cm_1、Ts_10cm_2、Ts_10cm_3、Ts_15cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_30cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm Ts_200cm、Ts_240cm、Ts_280cm、Ts_320cm）(单位：摄氏度)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min，2012年12月4日之前为30min平均，每天48个数据），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；土壤部分数据（平均土壤温度、土壤温度、土壤水分、土壤热通量）由于供电不足的原因，在2012年11月30日-12月8日和2013年4月21日-5月31日之间数据缺失；2、5m风速在2012年12月28日-2013年3月28日之间传感器维修，数据缺失；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2013-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al.(2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况下。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于估算不同植被类型、植被覆盖度、气候和空间尺度下的蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层），并与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果进行了比较。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，当EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在能量平衡闭合不完整时，这一任务变得更加困难。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这一温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该地区强烈的对流环境也是一个重要因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观测比率。
这封信的目的是利用通过高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散发（E）、土壤温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡度相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误造成的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计算为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速和湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig–Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则是通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出的。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热成像图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮度温度。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组分温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: The alpine region is important in riverine and watershed ecosystems as a contributor of freshwater, providing and stimulating specific habitats for biodiversity. In parallel, recent climate change, human activities, and other perturbations may disturb hydrological processes and eco-functions, creating the need for next-generation observational and modeling approaches to advance a predictive understanding of such processes in the alpine region. Water resources in the alpine region are headwaters that need to be regulated to sustain downstream ecosystems. However, perturbations induced by nature/climate change and human activities in recent years have significantly reformed hydrological processes and eco-functions. Accurate estimation and prediction of hydrological processes and their key impact factors has since become crucial.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. In comparison with the observations, using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes. However, due to the complexities of the earth system, there exist various sources of uncertainties in remote sensing data (especially in the alpine region), which have to be validated and calibrated. In summary, to fill the knowledge gap and promote alpine region hydrology research, an integrated, distributed and multiscale observation dataset is essential and expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models and ultimately improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. In alpine hydrology, in addition to consistent hydrometeorological data obtained from distributed meteorological stations, snow cover and frozen ground are two important indexes and driving forces that manipulate hydrological processes. The maximum snow water equivalent (SWE) before ablation determines the storage of snowmelt – a major source of freshwater in the alpine region, while freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs) and soil moisture within the active layer alter water infiltration and, consequently, surface runoff and groundwater. To promote alpine hydrology research, the International Network for Alpine Research Catchment Hydrology (INARCH) was launched in 2015 by the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) project of the World Climate Research Programme (WCRP), involving 18 catchments around the world. The INARCH has since connected individual observatories into an international network and data-share platform to lead frontier research on alpine region hydrometeorology and snow observation. Another community-based observation network, the Circumpolar Active Layer Monitoring (CALM) network, was initiated in the early 1990s to observe the response of the active layer and near-surface permafrost to climate change. The Heihe River Basin (HRB) is the second largest inland river basin in China and is known for its heterogeneous landscapes, diverse ecosystems, unique geographical characteristics and climate change over recent decades. As a major component of the ecohydrological processes in the arid/semi-arid HRB, the alpine hydrological processes, especially those related to snow cover and frozen ground in the upper reaches, have great impacts on runoff in the mountainous region, which then regulate agricultural development in the middle reaches and the ecosystems of the lower reaches.

In recent years, with climate warming, permafrost degradation has significantly affected runoff and the carbon cycle (Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018). Snow cover is widely distributed with unique characteristics in the study area. In the high-altitude mountainous region (elevation > 3800 m), influenced by the local microclimate and low temperature, snowfall could occur in any season. Temporary snow is the major snow cover type in the region at middle and low elevations because strong solar radiation and high air temperature lead to fast melting and sublimation of the snow. Drifting snow is also commonly observed in the region, which may lead to the redistribution of snowpack in high elevation regions (Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014).

Blowing (drifting) snow is commonly observed in the Qilian mountain due to its high altitude and complex terrain. It is important to estimate the occurrence of blowing snow because it may cause redistributions of the snow cover and influence the sublimation of snow.

Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.

This paper introduces the infrastructure of the integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the HRB and the complete datasets collected in recent years.

The associated open-access datasets include high-quality hydrometeorological data with specific respect to snow and frozen ground observations at the sub-basin and basin scales, which aims to address a variety of scientific questions including but not limited to: (1) how to provide accurate and effective forcing data for alpine hydrological models, (2) how to integrate observation, simulation and the acquired datasets for informative understanding, and (3) how perturbations (climate change and human activities) alter fundamental processes.

methods: Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data were monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). In addition, to capture snow accumulation and ablation processes, snow cover properties were collected from a snow observation superstation using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments. High-resolution soil physics datasets were also obtained to capture the freeze-thaw processes from a frozen ground observation superstation.

Considering the characteristics of the study site, an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network has been established with seven automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and two superstations. At the basin scale, the observation aims to collect data for investigating the meteorological driving forces and for validation of the alpine hydrological models. At the sub-basin scale, small-scale observations and measurements focus on data such as precipitation, soil temperature and moisture, which are used to develop and improve hydrologic models, as well as to validate remote sensing products at medium to coarse resolutions (Jin et al., 2014). At the two superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations, remote sensing products can be further validated using fine-resolution data. In total, seven AMSs, as well as the frozen ground and snow superstations (also incorporating meteorological observations), were established in the study area during the intensive observation period (IOP: 2013 -2014) to obtain the spatially distributed meteorological variables. After the IOP, four typical AMSs were selected and retained for continuous observation, which is expected to provide long-term datasets. The observed meteorological variables include wind (speed and direction), air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation. Accumulation and depletion processes were measured automatically at the Yakou snow superstation. The observed components included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE, measured by GammaMONitor, GMON), albedo of the snow surface and blowing (drifting) snow flux (measured by FlowCapt). Soil temperature and moisture were measured within six layers at each AMS, while evapotranspiration (ET) was observed by eddy covariance (EC) at three AMSs located in permafrost, seasonally frozen ground and a transient zone to observe freeze-thaw (FT) processes. At the sub-basin scale, a wireless sensor network (WSN) with 40 nodes was established to capture seasonal changes in soil temperature and moisture. At the A’rou frozen ground superstation, soil temperature and moisture profiles were intensively measured in eighteen layers to a depth of 3.2 m (in a nested pattern with more layers in the topsoil) to obtain the soil hydrothermal features under freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs). In addition, thermal conductivity and hydraulic conductivity in the topsoil were also measured to observe the dynamic hydrothermal processes within.

Snow depth was measured by SR50A (Campbell, USA), which determines the distance between the sensor and the target by sending out ultrasonic pulses and listening for the returning echoes reflected from the target. Snow water equivalent (SWE) was measured by GMON (CS725 GammaMONitor, Campbell, USA) from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 at a temporal resolution of 6 hr. FlowCapt (IAV, Switzerland) was used to measure the number of blowing snow grains at 3 heights (0-1 m, 1-2 m, and 2-3 m) every 10 mins.
dataset: The current study presents a suite of datasets consisting of long-term hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data for investigating watershed science and functions from an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) in China. Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data were monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). In addition, to capture snow accumulation and ablation processes, snow cover properties were collected from a snow observation superstation using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments. High-resolution soil physics datasets were also obtained to capture the freeze-thaw processes from a frozen ground observation superstation. The updated datasets were released to scientists with multidisciplinary backgrounds (i.e., cryosphere science, hydrology, and meteorology), and they are expected to serve as a testing platform to provide accurate forcing data and validate and evaluate remote sensing products and hydrological models for a broader community.

This paper introduces the infrastructure of the integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the HRB and the complete datasets collected in recent years. Composed of seven standard hydrometeorological stations, one snow superstation and one frozen ground superstation, the observation network serves as an integrated research platform aiming to provide prominent datasets (e.g., hydrometeorology, snow, and frozen ground) of the hydrometeorological processes in the upper reaches of the HRB, which is expected to support alpine region hydrological model development and simulations along with remote sensing observation.

A comprehensive snow dataset from the Yakou snow superstation has been updated since the summer of 2013. The observed snow variables included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE) and blowing (drifting) snow. Data obtained from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 are summarized in Figure 4, with additional plots for precipitation, ET, soil temperature and moisture. The datasets are available from 2012/12/05 to 2017/12/31, with intermittent loss mostly due to power loss and sensor malfunctions at high altitudes.

In this paper, a suite of alpine hydrology datasets observed from an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) is presented.
backgroundCn: 阿尔卑斯地区在河流和流域生态系统中具有重要意义，作为淡水的贡献者，为生物多样性提供并刺激特定栖息地。与此同时，近期气候变化、人类活动和其他扰动可能会干扰水文过程和生态功能，因此需要下一代观测和建模方法，以推进对阿尔卑斯地区这些过程的预测理解。阿尔卑斯地区的水资源是需要调节的源头水，以维持下游生态系统。然而，近年来自然/气候变化和人类活动引发的扰动显著改变了水文过程和生态功能。因此，准确估计和预测水文过程及其关键影响因素变得至关重要。

不幸的是，由于高山地区观测数据的稀缺，主要是由于获取困难和技术障碍，阻碍了高山水文建模及相关研究，但也促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。与观测数据相比，结合数据同化的遥感数据可以改善水文过程的预测。然而，由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据（尤其是在高山地区）存在各种不确定性来源，这些都需要进行验证和校准。总之，为了填补知识空白并促进高山地区水文学研究，集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测数据集是必不可少的，预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并最终改善对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。在高山水文学中，除了从分布式气象站获得的一致的水文气象数据外，雪盖和冻土是两个重要的指标和驱动因素，影响水文过程。融化前的最大雪水当量（SWE）决定了雪融水的储存——这是高山地区淡水的主要来源，而冻融循环（FTC）和活跃层内的土壤水分则改变了水的渗透，从而影响地表径流和地下水。为了促进高山水文学研究，国际高山研究流域水文学网络（INARCH）于2015年由世界气候研究计划（WCRP）的全球能量与水交换（GEWEX）项目发起，涉及全球18个流域。自那时以来，INARCH将各个观测站连接成一个国际网络和数据共享平台，以引领高山地区水文气象和雪观测的前沿研究。另一个基于社区的观测网络，极圈活跃层监测（CALM）网络，始于1990年代初，旨在观察活跃层和近地表永久冻土对气候变化的响应。黑河流域（HRB）是中国第二大内陆河流域，以其异质的景观、多样的生态系统、独特的地理特征和近年来的气候变化而闻名。作为干旱/半干旱黑河流域生态水文过程的主要组成部分，高山水文过程，特别是与上游雪盖和冻土相关的过程，对山区的径流产生了重大影响，从而调节了中游的农业发展和下游的生态系统。

近年来，随着气候变暖，永冻土退化显著影响了径流和碳循环（Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018）。研究区域内雪盖分布广泛，具有独特的特征。在高海拔山区（海拔 > 3800 米），受当地微气候和低温的影响，任何季节都有可能出现降雪。临时雪是该地区中低海拔地区的主要雪盖类型，因为强烈的太阳辐射和高气温导致雪的快速融化和升华。漂移雪在该地区也很常见，这可能导致高海拔地区雪层的重新分布（Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014）。
由于祁连山的高海拔和复杂地形，常常观察到吹雪（漂雪）现象。估计吹雪的发生非常重要，因为它可能导致雪盖的重新分布，并影响雪的升华。
土壤热导率的分析比较困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，而这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。
research objectiveCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从一个综合的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络中研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。
相关的开放获取数据集包括高质量的水文气象数据，特别是关于雪和冻土观测的数据，涵盖子流域和流域尺度，旨在解决多种科学问题，包括但不限于：（1）如何为高山水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，（2）如何整合观测、模拟和获取的数据集以获得有意义的理解，以及（3）扰动（气候变化和人类活动）如何改变基本过程。
challengesCn: 然而，寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔以及复杂的地形等几项严峻挑战，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。
不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文模型和相关研究的发展，但也促使了下一代生态观测网络和实验的开发。然而，上述建模工作面临着两个主要问题：1）强迫数据的可用性（只有中国气象局在HRB上游运营的两个气象站正常工作），以及2）缺乏高质量的雪和冻土数据用于参数化。
不幸的是，由于强风的影响，这种方法效果不佳。因此，目前无法获得可以通过雪深和雪水当量（SWE）数据计算的雪密度数据。
methodsCn: 无间断的气象和水文数据通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络进行监测。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从一个雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集也从一个冻土观测超级站获得，以捕捉冻融过程。

考虑到研究地点的特征，建立了一个综合的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络，包含七个自动气象站（AMS）和两个超级站。在流域尺度上，观测旨在收集数据以研究气象驱动因素，并验证阿尔卑斯水文模型。在子流域尺度上，小规模观测和测量集中在降水、土壤温度和湿度等数据上，这些数据用于开发和改进水文模型，以及验证中等到粗分辨率的遥感产品（Jin et al., 2014）。在两个雪盖和冻土观测的超级站中，可以利用高分辨率数据进一步验证遥感产品。在密集观测期（IOP：2013-2014）期间，在研究区域建立了七个AMS以及冻土和雪超级站（也包含气象观测），以获取空间分布的气象变量。在IOP之后，选择并保留了四个典型的AMS进行持续观测，预计将提供长期数据集。观测的气象变量包括风速和风向、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、四分量辐射和降水。积雪和融雪过程在Yakou雪超级站自动测量，观测的组成部分包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE，由GammaMONitor测量）、雪面反照率和风吹（飘雪）通量（由FlowCapt测量）。在每个AMS内，土壤温度和湿度在六个层次上进行测量，而蒸散发（ET）则在位于永久冻土、季节性冻土和过渡区的三个AMS上通过涡度协方差（EC）进行观测，以观察冻融（FT）过程。在子流域尺度上，建立了一个包含40个节点的无线传感器网络（WSN），以捕捉土壤温度和湿度的季节变化。在A’rou冻土超级站，土壤温度和湿度剖面在十八个层次上进行密集测量，深度达到3.2米（采用嵌套模式，表层有更多层次），以获取冻融循环（FTC）下的土壤水热特征。此外，还测量了表层土壤的热导率和水力导率，以观察动态水热过程。

雪深是通过SR50A（美国Campbell公司）测量的，该设备通过发出超声波脉冲并监听从目标反射回来的回声来确定传感器与目标之间的距离。雪水当量（SWE）是通过GMON（CS725 GammaMONitor，美国Campbell公司）在2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日期间以6小时的时间分辨率进行测量的。FlowCapt（瑞士IAV公司）用于测量在0-1米、1-2米和2-3米三个高度的吹雪颗粒数量，每10分钟测量一次。
datasetCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从综合、分布式和多尺度观测网络研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络，监测到了无间隙的气象和水文数据。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。还获得了高分辨率的土壤物理数据集，以捕捉冻融过程，这些数据来自冻土观测超级站。更新的数据集已向具有多学科背景的科学家发布（即冰冻圈科学、水文学和气象学），预计将作为测试平台，为更广泛的社区提供准确的强迫数据，并验证和评估遥感产品和水文模型。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施及近年来收集的完整数据集。该观测网络由七个标准水文气象站、一个雪超级站和一个冻土超级站组成，作为一个综合研究平台，旨在提供HRB上游水文气象过程的显著数据集（如水文气象、雪和冻土），预计将支持阿尔卑斯地区水文模型的开发和模拟以及遥感观测。
来自Yakou雪超级站的综合雪数据集自2013年夏季以来已更新。观察到的雪变量包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE）和吹雪（飘雪）。2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日的数据在图4中进行了总结，并附有降水、蒸散发、土壤温度和湿度的额外图表。数据集的可用时间为2012年12月5日至2017年12月31日，间歇性丢失主要是由于高海拔地区的电力损失和传感器故障。
在本文中，展示了一套来自于黑河上游集成的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络的阿尔卑斯水文数据集。

Definition.QuestionEn: How is 'gap-free meteorological and hydrological data' defined in the context of observation networks?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在观测网络的背景下，“无缺口气象和水文数据”如何定义？
Definition.AnswerEn: 'Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data' refers to datasets that are continuously and consistently collected over time without missing records, ensuring completeness for analysis. These datasets are gathered from a network of observation stations, which may include automatic meteorological stations and superstations dedicated to specific observations. The goal is to provide reliable data for hydrological modeling, remote sensing validation, and understanding environmental processes.
Definition.AnswerCn: “无缺失的气象和水文数据”是指在时间上连续且一致地收集的数据集，没有缺失记录，确保分析的完整性。这些数据集来自一个观测站网络，其中可能包括自动气象站和专门用于特定观测的超级站。其目标是提供可靠的数据，用于水文建模、遥感验证和理解环境过程。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in challenges faced during data collection for the TSEB model application in agricultural areas versus alpine hydrological observations in the Heihe River Basin?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在农业地区应用TSEB模型与在黑河流域进行高山水文观测时，数据收集面临的挑战有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The TSEB model application in agricultural areas faces challenges related to the uncertainty in surface-air temperature differences and errors from image classification, which affect the estimation of evapotranspiration components. On the other hand, alpine hydrological observations in the Heihe River Basin encounter challenges such as harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, which hinder consistent data collection and the development of remote sensing technologies.
Comparison.AnswerCn: TSEB模型在农业领域的应用面临着表面与空气温度差异的不确定性以及图像分类误差等挑战，这些因素影响了蒸散发成分的估算。另一方面，黑河流域的高山水文观测面临着恶劣气候、高海拔和复杂地形等挑战，这些因素阻碍了一致的数据收集和遥感技术的发展。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes data loss or inconsistency in meteorological and hydrological observations in alpine regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在高山地区，气象和水文观测中数据丢失或不一致的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Several challenges contribute to data loss or inconsistency in alpine regions, such as the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, which hinder consistent data collection and the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models. Additionally, power loss and sensor malfunctions at high altitudes lead to intermittent data loss.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区，多个挑战导致数据丢失或不一致，例如寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素妨碍了数据收集的一致性以及遥感技术和阿尔卑斯水文模型的发展。此外，高海拔地区的电力损失和传感器故障导致间歇性的数据丢失。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it difficult to accurately estimate soil heat conductivity in alpine environments?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在高山环境中，准确估计土壤热导率的难度是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze in alpine environments because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (including ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature. These parameters cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula, necessitating site observations to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 土壤热导率在高山环境中难以分析，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（包括冻土中的冰含量）和土壤温度的函数。这些参数无法通过简单公式轻易计算，需要现场观察来评估高山水文模型的参数化。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the factors that lead to the redistribution of snow cover in high-altitude regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致高海拔地区雪盖重新分布的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The redistribution of snow cover in high-altitude regions is often caused by blowing (drifting) snow, which is common due to the high altitude and complex terrain, such as in the Qilian Mountain. This phenomenon affects snowpack distribution and influences the sublimation of snow.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 高海拔地区的雪盖重新分布通常是由于风吹（漂移）雪造成的，这在高海拔和复杂地形（如祁连山）中很常见。这一现象影响雪层分布，并影响雪的升华。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What could be the potential outcomes of integrating remote sensing data with ground-based observations in alpine hydrological modeling?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 将遥感数据与地面观测数据整合到高山水文模型中的潜在结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating remote sensing data with ground-based observations in alpine hydrological modeling could improve the prediction of hydrological processes by providing more accurate forcing data, validating remote sensing data, and allowing for the evaluation of distributed models. This integration can address knowledge gaps and promote a better understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将遥感数据与地面观测数据整合在高山水文模型中，可以通过提供更准确的强迫数据、验证遥感数据以及评估分布式模型来改善水文过程的预测。这种整合可以填补知识空白，促进对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的更好理解。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What consequences might arise from the scarcity of observation data in alpine regions for hydrological research?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺可能对水文研究产生哪些后果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The scarcity of observation data in alpine regions can hinder hydrological research by limiting the accuracy and reliability of hydrological models. It can restrict the development of remote sensing technologies and create challenges in modeling efforts due to insufficient forcing data and a lack of high-quality snow and frozen ground data necessary for model parameterization.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺可能会妨碍水文研究，因为这会限制水文模型的准确性和可靠性。它可能会限制遥感技术的发展，并由于缺乏强迫数据以及缺乏高质量的雪和冻土数据，给建模工作带来挑战，这些数据对于模型参数化是必要的。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to develop next-generation ecosystem observation networks in alpine regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么在高山地区发展下一代生态观察网络很重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: It is important because the scarcity of observation data due to difficulties of access and technological barriers has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research, and these networks are expected to enhance data availability and improve the predictive understanding of hydrological processes in these regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 这很重要，因为由于获取困难和技术障碍，观测数据的稀缺阻碍了高山水文建模及相关研究，而这些网络预计将增强数据可用性并改善对这些地区水文过程的预测理解。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives behind using high-resolution soil physics datasets in alpine hydrology research?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在高山水文学研究中使用高分辨率土壤物理数据集的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objectives include capturing freeze-thaw processes, providing accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, and validating remote sensing products to improve the understanding and simulation of alpine hydrological processes.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标包括捕捉冻融过程，为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，以及验证遥感产品，以提高对高山水文过程的理解和模拟。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What processes and instruments are involved in collecting soil and canopy component temperatures to improve evapotranspiration estimation?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 收集土壤和冠层组成部分温度以改善蒸散发估算的过程和仪器有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The process involves using a high-resolution thermal camera to capture soil and canopy component temperatures. The thermal images are classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. These images are then used to calculate directional brightness temperatures, which are converted to radiation temperatures by considering incoming long-wave radiation and emissivities. The radiometric temperatures derived from these images are then validated against surface radiometric temperatures measured by a four-component radiometer.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 该过程涉及使用高分辨率热像仪捕捉土壤和树冠组件的温度。通过最大似然法将热图像分类为土壤像素和树冠像素。然后，这些图像用于计算方向亮度温度，考虑到入射的长波辐射和发射率，将其转换为辐射温度。通过四分量辐射计测量的表面辐射温度对这些图像得出的辐射温度进行验证。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How is the hydrometeorological data collected and integrated for alpine hydrological model development in challenging environments?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在挑战性环境中，如何收集和整合水文气象数据以开发高山水文模型？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Hydrometeorological data is collected through a network of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and superstations, capturing meteorological, snow, and frozen ground data. The network is designed to operate at multiple scales—basin and sub-basin—providing data such as wind speed, air temperature, humidity, precipitation, and soil moisture. Snow depth and snow water equivalent are measured using ultrasonic sensors and GammaMONitors, respectively. This integrated approach compensates for data scarcity in harsh alpine regions, supporting model development by providing accurate and distributed forcing data.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 水文气象数据通过自动气象站（AMSs）和超级站网络收集，捕捉气象、雪和冻土数据。该网络旨在在流域和子流域多个尺度上运行，提供风速、空气温度、湿度、降水量和土壤湿度等数据。雪深和雪水当量分别使用超声波传感器和GammaMONitors进行测量。这种综合方法弥补了恶劣高山地区数据稀缺的问题，通过提供准确和分布式的强迫数据支持模型开发。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methodologies are employed to ensure quality control and data integrity in the collection of multi-layer soil temperature and moisture data?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在多层土壤温度和湿度数据收集过程中，采用了哪些方法来确保质量控制和数据完整性？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Quality control involves several steps: ensuring consistent data collection with 144 data points per day (every 10 minutes), marking missing data with a placeholder, and addressing periods of data loss due to power issues. Data with obvious physical or instrument range errors are removed. Soil temperature and moisture are measured across multiple layers with redundancy at certain depths to ensure accuracy. The data is then processed to remove duplicate records and standardized in terms of format, including unified date and time recordings.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 质量控制涉及几个步骤：确保每天收集144个数据点（每10分钟一次），用占位符标记缺失数据，并处理由于电力问题导致的数据丢失。明显的物理或仪器范围错误的数据会被删除。土壤温度和湿度在多个层次上进行测量，并在某些深度上进行冗余以确保准确性。数据随后被处理以去除重复记录，并在格式上进行标准化，包括统一的日期和时间记录。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What are the key technological tools that enable the measurement of soil and canopy component temperatures in a heterogeneous landscape?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中，测量土壤和冠层组成部分温度的关键技术工具有哪些？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The measurement of soil and canopy component temperatures in a heterogeneous landscape is enabled by technological tools such as high-resolution thermal infrared cameras, which can capture thermal radiation and allow for the separation of soil and vegetation component temperatures. These images are then processed using methods like the maximum-likelihood classification to accurately determine component temperatures.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中，土壤和冠层组分温度的测量得益于高分辨率热红外相机等技术工具，这些相机能够捕捉热辐射，并允许分离土壤和植被组分的温度。然后，使用最大似然分类等方法处理这些图像，以准确确定组分温度。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How does the integration of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) facilitate the continuous collection of hydrometeorological data in alpine regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 自动气象站（AMSs）的集成如何促进阿尔卑斯地区水文气象数据的持续收集？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) facilitate the continuous collection of hydrometeorological data in alpine regions by providing a distributed network that captures essential variables such as wind speed, air temperature, humidity, and radiation at multiple locations. This setup allows for the monitoring of meteorological driving forces and aids in the validation of hydrological models.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 自动气象站（AMS）通过提供一个分布式网络，便于在高山地区连续收集水文气象数据，捕捉风速、气温、湿度和辐射等重要变量。这种设置允许监测气象驱动因素，并有助于水文模型的验证。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What challenges must be addressed to effectively utilize remote sensing data for predicting hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 有效利用遥感数据预测高山地区水文过程必须解决哪些挑战？
Enablement.AnswerEn: To effectively utilize remote sensing data for predicting hydrological processes in alpine regions, challenges such as the scarcity of observation data, the complexities of the earth system, and the validation and calibration of remote sensing data must be addressed. These challenges are compounded by the harsh climate, high altitudes, and complex topography, which inhibit data collection and model development.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 为了有效利用遥感数据预测高山地区的水文过程，必须解决观察数据稀缺、地球系统复杂性以及遥感数据的验证和校准等挑战。这些挑战因恶劣气候、高海拔和复杂地形而加剧，这些因素阻碍了数据收集和模型开发。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the expected challenges in collecting meteorological and hydrological data in alpine regions, and why might these challenges lead to data gaps or inaccuracies?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在高山地区收集气象和水文数据时，预期会面临哪些挑战，以及这些挑战为何可能导致数据缺口或不准确？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Several formidable challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed. This scarcity of observation data has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research, influencing the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 几个严峻的挑战，包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，阻碍了在需要时进行全面和一致的数据收集。这种观测数据的稀缺妨碍了高山水文模型及相关研究的发展，影响了遥感技术和高山水文模型的进步。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might integrating a distributed and multiscale observation network be anticipated to improve the quality and applicability of hydrological datasets in alpine environments?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么整合分布式和多尺度观测网络预计会提高高山环境中水文数据集的质量和适用性？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Integrating a distributed and multiscale observation network is expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, and allow for the evaluation of distributed models, ultimately improving a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 集成一个分布式和多尺度的观测网络预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，并允许评估分布式模型，最终提高对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of the integrated, distributed and multiscale observation network in capturing hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估集成的、分布式的和多尺度观测网络在捕捉高山地区水文过程中的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The integrated, distributed and multiscale observation network is effective in capturing hydrological processes in alpine regions as it includes a combination of automatic meteorological stations, snow cover superstations, and frozen ground superstations. This comprehensive setup allows for the monitoring of key variables such as snow depth, soil temperature, and moisture, which are crucial for understanding hydrological dynamics in these areas.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 集成的、分布式的多尺度观测网络在捕捉高山地区的水文过程方面非常有效，因为它包括自动气象站、雪盖超级站和冻土超级站的组合。这种综合设置能够监测雪深、土壤温度和湿度等关键变量，这些变量对于理解这些地区的水文动态至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your opinion, what are the advantages of using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation in alpine hydrology research?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在阿尔卑斯水文学研究中，结合遥感数据和数据同化的优势是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of remote sensing data combined with data assimilation in alpine hydrology research offers the advantage of improving the prediction of hydrological processes, especially in areas where ground-based observations are scarce. This approach allows for the integration of large-scale observations with local data, enhancing the accuracy and reliability of hydrological models.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 遥感数据与数据同化相结合在高山水文学研究中的应用，提供了改善水文过程预测的优势，特别是在地面观测稀缺的地区。这种方法允许将大规模观测与地方数据相结合，提高水文模型的准确性和可靠性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection techniques can effectively manage the challenges of high altitude and complex topography in alpine regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据收集技术如何有效管理高海拔和复杂地形在阿尔卑斯地区的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The data collection techniques in alpine regions involve an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network, including automatic meteorological stations and superstations for snow and frozen ground. These setups help capture the required data with specific instruments like ultrasonic sensors for snow depth and GammaMONitor for snow water equivalent, which are suited for the harsh climate and complex topography.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区的数据收集技术涉及一个综合的、分布式的、多尺度的观测网络，包括自动气象站和用于雪和冻土的超级站。这些设置通过特定的仪器捕获所需的数据，如用于雪深的超声波传感器和用于雪水当量的GammaMONitor，这些仪器适合于恶劣的气候和复杂的地形。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the data collection techniques used in hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground observations within the alpine region.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn:
在高山地区，水文气象、雪盖和冻土观测中使用的数据收集技术包括：

1. **气象站**：安装自动气象站以收集温度、湿度、降水量、风速和风向等气象数据。
2. **遥感技术**：利用卫星和无人机获取雪盖和冻土分布的遥感影像，分析其变化。
3. **地面观测**：通过实地测量雪深、雪密度和冻土厚度等参数，获取详细的地面数据。
4. **水文监测**：在河流和湖泊中设置水位计和流量计，监测水文循环和水资源变化。
5. **土壤传感器**：使用土壤温度和湿度传感器监测冻土层的变化。
6. **气象模型**：结合气象模型和观测数据进行气候模拟和预测分析。

这些技术的结合使得对高山地区的水文气象、雪盖和冻土的监测和研究更加全面和准确。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Data collection techniques in the alpine region include the use of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) for continuous meteorological data, snow observation superstations with state-of-the-art instruments for snow properties, and frozen ground superstations for freeze-thaw processes. These techniques capture a comprehensive range of variables such as wind speed, air temperature, humidity, snow depth, snow water equivalent, soil temperature, and moisture at various depths.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区的数据收集技术包括使用自动气象站（AMSs）进行连续气象数据的收集，配备先进仪器的雪观测超级站用于雪的特性观测，以及用于冻土过程的冻土超级站。这些技术捕捉了包括风速、气温、湿度、雪深、雪水当量、土壤温度和不同深度的土壤湿度等多种变量。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify and analyze the challenges faced in collecting and maintaining high-quality datasets in the alpine region.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别和分析在阿尔卑斯地区收集和维护高质量数据集所面临的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting datasets in the alpine region include harsh climatic conditions, high altitudes, and complex topographies, which can hinder data collection consistency and equipment operation. Additionally, power loss and sensor malfunctions at high altitudes lead to intermittent data loss, complicating the acquisition of a complete and consistent dataset.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区收集数据集的挑战包括恶劣的气候条件、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素可能会妨碍数据收集的一致性和设备的正常运行。此外，高海拔地区的电力损失和传感器故障导致间歇性的数据丢失，使得获取完整和一致的数据集变得更加复杂。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential strategies for expanding and refining datasets of hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground observations in alpine regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨在高山地区扩展和完善水文气象、雪盖和冻土观测数据集的潜在策略。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential strategies for expanding and refining datasets in alpine regions include enhancing the observation network with additional automated stations for broader spatial coverage, integrating remote sensing data for large-scale observations, and employing data assimilation techniques to improve prediction accuracy. These approaches can help fill existing data gaps and facilitate the validation and calibration of remote sensing products.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区，扩展和完善数据集的潜在策略包括通过增加自动气象站来增强观测网络，以实现更广泛的空间覆盖，整合遥感数据以进行大规模观测，以及采用数据同化技术以提高预测准确性。这些方法可以帮助填补现有的数据空白，并促进遥感产品的验证和校准。
